column1: National railways: Public Performance Measure, annual from 2002/03
1. PPM is a measure of the percentage of trains arriving on time. A train is defined as on time if it arrives at its destination within five minutes of the planned arrival time for
London and South East and regional operators, or within ten minutes for long-distance operators.
2. Break in the series due to change in methodology (see Notes and Definitions).
